item.title: Frédéric PÉCHENARD
item.description: Frédéric Péchenard, former head of the French National Police and best friend of Éric Andrieu.

item.title: Éric ANDRIEU
item.description: Éric Andrieu, best friend of Frédéric Péchenard. An independent investigation should determine whether Éric Andrieu could be affiliated to Thomas Andrieu. Most likely not.

item.title: Eric Andrieu, lawyer, Péchenard & Associés
item.description: From: Eric Andrieu (Péchenard & Associés law firm) To: Vincent B. Le Corre On October 27, 2015, I received an email from McDonald’s France lawyer Éric Andrieu of the Péchenard & Associés law firm. https://archive20210730.auxjournalistes.com/docs/emails/McDonaldsReceivedFrom/2015-10-27-16h00-Eric_Andrieu_Avocat_McDonalds_France_Redacted.pdf The lawyer commits an exceptionally serious mistake (legal malpractice) by confirming “to [his] clients that the sweepstakes [note: actually a serious fraud] was in compliance with French and European law.” This is obviously false. Either he is dangerously incompetent, or he is complicit.

item.title: Evidence - law review article by McDonald’s attorney
item.description: Type of evidence: law review article written by McDonald’s attorney Éric Andrieu from the Péchenard & Associés law firm. Click on this link to visualize the original document: evidence-law-review-article-from-mcdonalds-attorney-may-2014-european-parliament.pdf Highlighting McDonald’s legal counsel Éric Andrieu’s association with the Péchenard & Associés law firm, it’s noteworthy that he authored a law review article published on May 1, 2014. In this piece, he references the European Parliament’s resolution dated February 4, 2014, concerning the Unfair Commercial Practices Directive 2005/29/EC (2013/2116(INI)).
